intro: Galium willkommianum, commonly known as Willkomm's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Galium willkommianum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
